title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
OB: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, there is no confirmation message that the output directory can be deleted and rebuilt. As a result, some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory that contains more than just .class files, which can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the application
2. Create a new project
3. Choose an existing directory structure as the project location
4. Point the output folder to a directory that contains non-.class files
5. Try to create the project

Expected behavior: There should be a confirmation message stating that the output directory will be deleted and rebuilt. The user should be able to proceed with the project creation only after confirming this action.
